intro: Cyrilla microareolata, commonly known as the small-areola Cyrilla, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as swamps and marshes, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. Cyrilla microareolata is a member of the Lythraceae family, which includes other ornamental and ecologically important plants. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both ecological studies and horticultural interest.
